subject: Test Dependency
msgSnippet: Hi Say I have a Project class and Experiment class that I need to test using Junit. They are simple codes that writes into the database. The rule is a Project
messageBody:
Hi

Say I have a Project class and Experiment class that I need to test using
Junit. They are simple codes that writes into the database. The rule is a
Project must be added before a Experiment can be added. This is
because Experiment has a foreign key that points to Project.

So I have two test class, ProjectTest and ExperimentTest.

In my ProjectTest I have a testCreateProject test. But in my
ExperimentTest where I have my testCreateExperiment test, I need to
create a project before it will be successful.

Whats the practice for this? Do I put the createProject inside my
testCreateExperiment method? Then I will be actually testing two different
class (Project and Experiment) in a single method
(testCreateExperiment)..

If anyone is going to suggest control the order of executing the test (i.e.
run ProjectTest before ExperimentTest), note that I need the return value
from testCreateProject in testCreateExperiment.

Thanks

Sebastian Ho
